title: Monitoring and Evaluation Coordinator - International Programs - Bilingual
content:
About the RoleAs the Monitoring and Evaluation Coordinator for International Programs, you will Shine Hope by working with the Program Development & Design (PDD) team and the International Operations teams to oversee data management system implementation including training, process improvement, system-related support, and quality assurance. As the Coordinator, you will oversee the Continuous Quality Improvement process for International Programs, working collaboratively with the PDD and International Ops Teams to drive organizational learning, growth, and alignment. You are also responsible for ensuring that program outputs and outcomes are tracked across BCFS so that the PDD team can analyze trends to inform decision-making. Also responsible for reporting program outputs and outcomes for internal and external stakeholders. 
What you will doAs a member of our team you will have an impact on our clients through accomplishment of the following responsibilities:

Act as the System Administrator for BCFS International Case Management Systems including conducting ongoing training for staff, providing system support, managing system errors, improving system processes, and working with third party system staff to resolve issues.
Support the development and implementation of BCFS organization wide planning and monitoring frameworks including Continuous Quality Improvement & Compliance (CQI-C), with a focus on International Programs
Support Development and Government Relations teams by gathering program data for proposals and reports.
Process and maintain data from a variety of sources including, but is not limited to, reviewing data for accuracy, making process adjustments to increase efficiency, and assessing trends or gaps across the organization.
Build tabular and/or visualization reports as needed. Build and flesh out data models in our database for use in regular and/or automated reporting and analysis. Work with a variety of data sources to extract knowledge and actionable information from massive datasets.
Manage collaboration with the Senior Director of Program Development and Design and operations staff to define specific and measurable outcomes for each program/Collaborate and integrate outcome measurement into the reporting process. Manage tasks and projects assigned by the Senior Director and other team members as directed.
Work with Senior Director of Program Development and Design in increasing the quality and indicators (KPIs) for all programs.
Using project management methodologies, integrate data and information from corporate strategic projects and/or programs and evaluate how higher-level objectives are being fulfilled according to the respective scope; serve as liaison between departments as appropriate. Consult on, support and require compliance, or take control and directly manage projects as assigned.
Ability to lead process trainings with staff across the organization on Buckner best practices both virtually and in-person. Ability to travel internationally at least 3 times per year to facilitate in-country trainings with Buckner International teams.
Monitor current trends in social service data collection and analysis processes. Implement evidence-based best practices for data collection. Help form data management and governance processes within the team. Convey your work and results to a wide variety of internal and external stakeholders.

 As a 5 STARS team member, you’ll bring to the team:To be successful in this role and a great addition to our team we need you to come with the following:

Bachelor’s Degree in statistics, math, computer science, business, social work, or other technical related field of study required.
Minimum 2 years working experience working with project management, case management systems, and social service programs required.
Ability to speak, read, and write Spanish required.
Must be age 21 or older to drive on behalf of Buckner.
Shining hope in others. (Your friendly attitude and willingness to learn is more important than a year’s experience!)

Preferred QualificationsIn addition to the amazing qualifications and experiences listed above, if we had our say, we would also look for:

Master’s Degree in Business Administration, Social Work, or Data Analytics preferred.
Minimum 2 years work experience supporting business operations and process development in an analytics capacity preferred. 
Cross-cultural project management experience preferred.
Certification in project management preferred.
Experience with SQL Server and Excel strongly preferred.
Experience with BI tools such as Metabase, BOARD, Tableau, Zoho Analytics, PowerBI, Looker, or Snowflake preferred.
A commitment to your own professional growth and development to enhance program services.
A willingness and desire to build and maintain excellent working relationships with your co-workers, volunteers, and the community that we rely on to support our programs.

Our 5 STARS Perks:

Medical and Dental benefits for associates and their eligible dependents.
Payactiv, early access paid wages
Life insurance.
Short-Term and Long-Term Disability benefits.
Paid Time Off and Holidays.
Paid Parental Leave.
Retirement Savings Plan.
The 5 STARS Fun Benefit: encourages employees to spread good cheer to their co-workers and others, creating a happy, healthy environment for all!

Benefits eligibility is based on number of hours worked each week.The same way we treat our employees is how we treat all applicants – with respect. Buckner is an equal opportunity employer (EEO is the law). You will be treated fairly throughout our recruiting process and without regard to race, color, religion, ​age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status in consideration for a career at Buckner.
